<!-- badges: end -->

The bartools package is an R-based toolkit for the analysis of synthetic DNA barcodes in

high throughput genome and transcriptome sequencing datasets.

See `vignette(bartools)` for more details and usage examples.

## Installation

You can install the development version of bartools from [GitHub](https://github.com/):

```{r}
install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("DaneVass/bartools", dependencies = TRUE)
```

## bartools examples

bartools can preprocess, normalise and visualise all types of synthetic barcode count data.

```{r}
library(bartools)
data("test.counts")
```

## plot from counts files

```{r}
plotBarcodeBubble(test.counts)

```

```{r}
plotBarcodeCounts(test.counts)

```

```{r}
plotBarcodeHistogram(test.counts, sample = "T0-1", top = 100)

```

```{r}
plotReadCounts(test.counts, group = c("A", "A", "B", "B"))

```
